meanings.definition: The flow of a liquid or gas in the opposite direction from its normal course.
meanings.sent1: The plumber fixed the backflow issue in the pipes.
meanings.sent2: The backflow of water in the river caused flooding downstream.
meanings.sent3: The backflow of soda in the straw surprised the child.
meanings.sent4: The backflow of emotions overwhelmed her heart.
meanings.sent5: The backflow of traffic made the intersection chaotic.

meanings.definition: To flow in the opposite direction from its normal course.
meanings.sent1: After heavy rain, the river began to backflow towards the mountains.
meanings.sent2: When the drain is clogged, water can backflow into the sink.
meanings.sent3: The balloon backflowed air when squeezed too hard.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts backflowed to happier times.
meanings.sent5: The lava backflowed down the volcano, creating a dangerous situation.
